item.title: Isosceles trapezoids of unit area with vertices in sets of infinite planar measure
item.description: arXiv:2501.01914v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Paul Erd\H{o}s posed the question of whether every measurable planar set of infinite Lebesgue measure contains the four vertices of an isosceles trapezoid of unit area. In this paper, we provide an affirmative answer to this question. Additionally, we present affirmative solutions to similar questions by Erd\H{o}s concerning isosceles triangles and right-angled triangles.
item.dc:creator: Junnosuke Koizumi

item.title: Quadruple Inequalities: Between Cauchy-Schwarz and Triangle
item.description: arXiv:2307.01361v4 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We prove a set of inequalities that interpolate the Cauchy-Schwarz inequality and the triangle inequality. Every nondecreasing, convex function with a concave derivative induces such an inequality. They hold in any metric space that satisfies a metric version of the Cauchy-Schwarz inequality, including all CAT(0) spaces and, in particular, all Euclidean spaces. Because these inequalities establish relations between the six distances of four points, we call them quadruple inequalities. In this context, we introduce the quadruple constant - a real number that quantifies the distortion of the Cauchy-Schwarz inequality by a given function. Additionally, for inner product spaces, we prove an alternative, more symmetric version of the quadruple inequalities, which generalizes the parallelogram law.
item.dc:creator: Christof Sch\"otz

item.title: A remark on dimensionality reduction in discrete subgroups
item.description: arXiv:2501.01396v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this short note, we prove a version of the Johnson-Lindenstrauss flattening Lemma for point sets taking values in discrete subgroups. More precisely, given $d,\lambda_0,N_0\in\mathbb{N}$, a point set $\mathcal{D}\subset\frac{1}{\lambda_0}\mathbb{Z}^d\cap B(0,N_0)$ with cardinality $|\mathcal{D}|=d$, and $\epsilon\in \left(0,\frac{1}{2}\right)$ suitably chosen, we show that there exist a scaling factor $\lambda=\lambda(\epsilon,N_0)\in\mathbb{N}$ that does not depend on the dimension $d$, and an (affine) embedding $F:\mathcal{D}\to\frac{1}{\lambda}\mathbb{Z}^k$, where $k=k(d,\epsilon)=O\left(\frac{1}{\epsilon^2}\log d\right)$, with distortion at most $\left(1+\epsilon+\frac{\epsilon}{\lambda_0}\right)$.
item.dc:creator: Rodolfo Viera
